page.title: 13BIRDS & PONDS MARTON/N'THPE
page.content: The D block provided extensive countryside and urbanised land for study. On the 15th and 16th June, 1985 a bird survey in Marton established that the most numerous species of birds were{Starling, House Sparrow, {Blackbird, Rook, Song Thrush, {Woodpigeon, Bluetit, Chaffinch, {Greenfinch and Carrion Crow}(in descending order). Marton is largely a residential area and the birds were seen in a garden. A survey at Nunthorpe School field, which is in a rural environment, established the{ {Carrion Crow}as most often seen, followed by{Sparrows, Blackbird, {Thrush, Swallow and Rook.}At 26 Guisborough Rd., in Mrs Morton's garden is a pond. We found{bullrushes} and an empty wild duck's nest. There were{water beetles, pond skaters and {tadpoles}in the pond.
